sub_title: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV
summary:
A dedicated and results-driven IFS Functional Consultant with a highly successful academic background and sound functional expertise on diverse areas. Experienced in working with leading brands in the extremely competitive industries of Aerospace, MRO, Automobile, FMCGs, Capital Markets, Defense, Oil, Telecommunications, NDT, Laundry and Catering ensuring high precision and quality aspects of the products and the services. 

Possesses excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills and the ability to develop and maintain mutually beneficial internal and external relationships. Enjoys being part of, as well as managing, motivating and training, a successful and productive team, and thrives in highly pressurized and challenging working environments.

Being an engineer/ production manager turned IFS consultant, I have played major roles in all stages of ERP lifecycle in Implementing, Enhancing, Upgrading, Rolling out, Supporting and Replacing IFS applications for customers throughout the globe. 

I further have given leadership for teams with members from different disciplines to successfully achieve goals and objectives of the organizations and the projects that I have worked on.

Areas of expertise:
- Manufacturing
- Distribution and Supply Chain Management
- Quality Management
- Maintenance
- Vehicle Information Management (VIM)/ MRO
- Project Management
- Document Management

Get in touch at saraheshan@gmail.com or call on +94718026134.

projects.title: GA Telesis Engine Services Oy - Helsinki, Finland
projects.description:
GA Telesis Engine Services at Finland is upgrading their ERP solution from IFS Applications ver. 2004 to ver. 10, with the core solution consisting IFS Complex MRO.
I, along with six functional and technical consultants from WebQuarters, based on-site,  provide the business with consultancy and support services for the upgrade.
I act as the project lead from WebQuarters and as a techno-functional consultant involved in variety of project related activities including:
- Requirement analysis and solution mapping
- Gap analysis, providing work-arounds and developing specifications for customizations
- Designing and development of custom configurations (Custom events, custom fields and custom menus)
- Super user training
- Data cleansing and migrations
- Report designing and development 
- Coordinating User Acceptance Testing
- Designing and development of transition and cut-over related tasks

projects.title: Bodycote – Macclesfield, United Kingdom
projects.description:
Bodycote PLC is one of UK’s leading supplier of heat treatments, metal joining, hot isostatic pressing and coatings services, Based in Macclesfield, United Kingdom. It is an organization which has grown through acquisitions and thus different entities of theirs are using different ERP systems. Consequently they are in the process of evaluating an ERP solution in order to unify all their business and had shortlisted IFS Applications and Infor M3 as the potential candidates.

I, representing Totalamber along with a team from Merit Globe, who are partners for Infor M3, carried out workshops onsite identifying the unique requirements of different SBUs of Bodycote, designing a solution from respective ERPs, analysing the Gap-Fit and the level of customizations required.
I came up with a proposal comprising of Component MRO solution of IFS applications and demonstrated that the vanilla solution could serve more than 80% their requirements.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV
Group Executive Director at Enterprise Analytics

projects.title: Müller Milk & Ingredients - United Kingdom
projects.description:
Müller Milk & Ingredients is the largest milk supplier and distributor in Great Britain. They have ten major dairies in Aberdeen, East Kilbride, Glasgow, Manchester, Droitwich Spa, Bridgwater, Severnside, Chadwell Heath, Foston and Hanworth. They acquired Dairy Crest, another leading British dairy products company in 2015.
Totalamber was requested to perform a Support Needs Analysis (SNA) based on their as-is support landscape and also to provide projections for their to-be support landscape in relation with on-boarding the Dairy Crest SBUs. This exercise also incorporated an as-is process mapping of their major process flows. I along with three other business analysts carried out an on-site assessment on the support landscape of Müller and provided them with recommendations on improving it. We further carried out workshops with the business users and the management of different departments and documented the business processes. My major responsibilities on the project included:
-	Multi-dimensional statistical analysis of the data from Müller Service Desk and deriving predictions for the to-be support landscape.
-	Developing a business case and the proposal for the Service Desk functionality to be provided by Totalamber.
-	Conducting workshops and interviews with the business users and documenting the major workflows.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV

projects.title: Mistras – Princeton, NJ, USA - IFS Applications Ver. 7.5/ Ver. 9
projects.description:
MISTRAS is a leading "one source" global provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the structural integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructure. They have operations all around the world including USA, UK, France and Germany.
Totalamber was commissioned by Mistras management to assess its AS-IS Business As Usual Landscape and provide recommendations for re-engineering its business processes in line with their plan to upgrade to IFS version 9.0 from version 7.5. I played a major role in the as-is business process identification exercise which spanned across five weeks and was carried out in about 15 sites across different states of USA. I further took part in the analysis phase where the data from the onsite interviews and the structured questionnaires were drilled down and analyzed via different statistical methodologies in order to assess the as-is business processes and provide functional and technical recommendations for improving their business as usual landscape and to optimize their ERP utilization with the features and functionalities of IFS Applications Ver 9.0. My Major responsibilities included:
-	Carrying out group discussions with different department representatives in order to identify the as-is processes of each silos.
-	Conducting one-on-one interviews with the different stakeholders of the business in order to identify their roles, major issues in their processes and their recommendations for improvements.
-	Analyzing the responses from the interviews and the questionnaires and coming up with recommendations for Business Process Reengineering in line with the IFS version upgrade.
-	Analyzing the customizations, limitations and issues in their current ERP landscape and providing resolutions based on the features and functionalities of IFS Applications ver. 9.0.
-	Actively taking part in planning and execution of the BPR activities proposed during the assessment phase.

projects.title: Wrightbus – Ballymena, Northern Ireland - IFS Applications Ver. 8
projects.description:
With the successful implementation of IFS applications in Wrightbus India facility, I was engaged into the IFS applications implementation in their head office plant in Ballymena, Northern Ireland. Being a phased implementation spanning multiple years and multiple companies, I was initially involved in their first IFS Applications go-live with the company Metallix, subsidiary of Wrightbus. I was stationed in Ballymena for six months and was involved in:
-	Solution Design, Prototyping and Testing
o	Assisting project team with process mapping
o	Designing, documenting and testing of custom items to cater specific requirements
o	Assisting in overall solution testing (AST and CST etc.)
-	Engineering Change Control
Provided functional consultancy for the subproject of Engineering Change Control, which involved integration of different systems used for maintaining Engineering design and changes with IFS applications. 
-	Migrating opening balances related to manufacturing (stock and WIP etc.)
-	Creating ad-hoc SQL based reports for catering different requirements of the super users
-	Pre-go-live and Post-go-live support
-	Liaising and coordinating with different teams including the on-site and remote technical and functional teams, project team, Wrightbus management, super users, end users, software vendors and other third party support providers etc., in order to deliver a satisfactory solution for all the stakeholders.

projects.title: Serimax - Roissy, France - IFS Applications Ver. 7.5
projects.description:
Serimax, part of the Pipe Projects division within the Vallourec Group, serves as a full service welding company offering fully integrated welding solutions for operations on land and at sea. Serimax has implemented IFS Projects, Distribution and Finance Modules since 2008 and its utilization spans the organization's global operations spread in France, USA, UK, Russia, Malaysia and Singapore etc. Furthermore they use Novacura Flow in connection with IFS in order to handle the inventory movements at their offline rigs.
Totalamber was chosen as the ERP Support Partner by Serimax in 2014. I along with four Totalamber consultants carried out an on-site Support Need Analysis (SNA) and a Process Identification initially at their Head Quarters in Villepinte, France. Subsequently I was assigned as the Support Delivery Lead for the project in delivering 24x5 support. The main duties of my role included:
-	Providing ERP Support for all the sites of Serimax adhering to the agreed SLAs and exceeding customer expectations.
-	Coordination between the client, 1st Line Support, 2nd Line Support and the Support Management team in relation with the project activities.
-	Establishing and maintaining Case Management Portal in adherence with customer specific requirements liaising with Totalamber’s ITSM team.
-	Preparation and presentation of weekly, monthly and quarterly support status reports to the client depicting the current status of the support activities, performance with respect to the SLAs, issues, risks and areas of focus.
-	Developing the account by identifying the business opportunities and providing solutions beneficial to both Serimax and Totalamber.

projects.title: Shawcor Limited - Global - IFS Applications Ver. 7.5 / Ver. 8
projects.description:
Shawcor is a global energy services company that operates through ten divisions which focus on technology-based products and services for the pipeline and pipe services market and the petrochemical and industrial market with manufacturing and service facilities located in over fifteen countries around the world. They have implemented IFS on all the companies under their group and utilizes different modules of IFS including Enterprise Asset Management, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Distribution, Sales, Finance, Document Management and Quality Management etc. in each of those.
I was involved in providing global support services for Shawcor on 24x7 basis on their IFS deployment and was mainly responsible for providing 2nd line Functional Support for Shawcor. Furthermore I took part in the initial business process analysis on-site at Houston, Texas.

projects.description:
Totalamber has been providing 2nd line support for IFS ERP systems for British pottery manufacturer Churchill China. I played a major role in providing remote functional support in distribution, manufacturing and HR modules while playing the role as the account manager in service delivery.
Furthermore I undertook the role as the project manager for a project on developing a Time, Attendance and Payroll Management application which runs on IFS Human Resource Management module. In addition to the duties in project management, I was also involved in quality assurance and testing aspects of the application.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV

projects.title: Wrightbus International – Chennai, India - IFS Applications - Ver. 8
projects.description:
Daimler India Commercial Vehicles, manufacturing Mercedes Benz commercial vehicles in India has outsourced its bus manufacturing arm to Wrightbus, the Northern Irish Coachbuilder. Wrightbus International, with the start of their operations in Channai – Thamilnadu, had selected IFS as its ERP system and had planned to go-live with IFS Distribution, Manufacturing and Finance modules. Totalamber was chosen by Wrightbus as their implementation partner and I, as the main manufacturing consultant, was stationed on-site for six weeks where I played a major role in implementing IFS Applications Ver. 8 in both their bus manufacturing plant and the fiber reinforced plastic manufacturing plant. I was responsible in:
-	Project Management and coordination
-	Requirement Gathering
-	Solution design, Prototyping and Testing
o	Mapping the processes in line with IFS functionality and industry best practices
o	Designing, documenting and testing custom items in order to cater specific requirements
o	Simulating the processes with the process owners, fine-tuning the solution to meet their demands
-	Acquisition and setting up basic data and master data
-	Identification and definition of roles and responsibilities 
-	Super User Training
-	User Acceptance Testing
-	Migrating opening balances related to manufacturing (stock and WIP etc.)
-	Pre-go-live and post-go-live support
-	Risk Management, Quality Management and Change Management

projects.title: Seadrill Limited – Dubai, United Arab Emirates - IFS Applications Ver. 7.5
projects.description:
Seadrill, one of the leading offshore deep-water drilling company utilizes the IFS Logistics and Maintenance modules integrated with number of other systems including Oracle ERP Systems and Eye-share via Microsoft BizTalk Server. Furthermore they have deployed IFS Replications functionality to synchronize the offshore servers, which are established at their oil rigs spread throughout the globe, with their onshore server.
I was a member of the team from Totalamber which analysed their system for its effective utilization and the user satisfaction. Furthermore I played a major role as a member of the on-site team which carried out system and process improvements. I was also involved in monitoring the replication process  between the onshore and the offshore servers and resolving the issues arising on a 24x7 basis.

projects.title: Counter-Narcoterrorism Global Support (CNGS) - IFS Applications Ver. 7.5/  Ver. 8
projects.description:
DynCorp International, United States based military subcontractor is managing the aircraft fleet of the Afghan Ministry of Defence and the Ministry of Interior under Counter-Narcoterrorism Global Support (CNGS) program (Contracted under Northrop Grumman). They had deployed IFS MRO and Logistics modules four years ago but had been unable to effectively utilize the tool. A team consisting of myself and Renato - an experienced aviation consultant analysed the system on-site and provided comprehensive plan for restructuring which was carried out as a project in two phases, which was managed by me with a project team of six consultants. The activities that I was responsible and which was accomplished both on-site and off-site included:
-	Coordination of activities between the customer and the consultants
-	Definition of process flows, process mapping and improvements
-	Restructuring the basic data for maintenance and data cleansing
-	Training: Management, Admin users, Super users and End users
-	Preparation of user manuals
-	Revising the business roles and setting the appropriate privileges and permissions in the system 
-	Developing applications which communicates with the IFS backend database to cater the special requirements of the users
-	Identifying, deploying and improving the reporting

projects.title: Airbus A350 XWB THSA SLPEDS LSPs
projects.description:
Two Load Sensing Pin types were designed and prototypes were developed for the trimmable horizontal stabilizer actuator (THSA) secondary load path engagement detection system (SLPEDS) of the Airbus A350 XWB aircraft in Aero Sense UK facility. As the Project Manager from Aero Sense Sri Lanka, I was responsible for transferring the project from the UK facility of Aero Sense to the Sri Lankan facility and for developing it to the manufacturing phase, collaborating with my UK counterpart Adrian. I underwent thorough training on the already developed process for LSP manufacturing in UK prior to initiate the transition. The major responsibilities that I held as the Project Manager, for the transition included:
- Establishing, developing, adapting and improving the manufacturing processes, equipment, tools, fixtures, test beds and systems to suit a large scale production.
- Carrying out training on production and testing processes.
- Planning and allocation of necessary resources (human, machinery, work centers etc ) for the production.
- Coordination of raw material sourcing based on the customer demand.
- Implementing the quality assurance criteria for production in line with AS9100 standards, the standards set by Rockwell Collins - who is responsible for manufacturing the THSA - and the standards specified by AIRBUS(GRESS). 
- Flowing down and ensuring that the same quality criteria is being adhered by the suppliers for the project.
- Preparation, maintenance and coordination of comprehensive set of documentation with regard to the aforementioned quality criteria.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV
Software Manager at KLA

projects.title: GIS Based Passenger Guidance System
projects.description: This project was undertaken as the final year group project with three of my colleagues and was completed with great success. At the completion, we could provide the passengers with optimum path from a particular origin to a destination based on the static and dynamic data. We utilized Geographic Information System (GIS), Magnetic Vehicle Sensing Techniques, database management systems and optimal path algorithms while the developed system was accessible via GSM, GPRS and the World Wide Web.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV

profile_positions.description:
As Senior Solution Architect for Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV, I oversee the design and implementation of technology solutions to support the company's global operations. My role requires a deep understanding of the company's business processes and systems, as well as expertise in a range of technologies and platforms.

My key responsibilities include developing technical strategies and roadmaps, collaborating with business stakeholders to identify and prioritize requirements, and leading cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions on time and within budget. I also provide technical leadership and guidance to other members of the IT team, ensuring that they are equipped with the skills and knowledge needed to deliver successful outcomes.

In my current position, I play a critical role in several major projects, including the implementation of a new ERP system, the migration of legacy systems to the cloud, and the development of new customer-facing applications. My contributions are instrumental in helping the company achieve its business goals and remain competitive in a rapidly evolving market.

In addition to my technical expertise, I am also known for my strong communication and collaboration skills. I work closely with stakeholders across the company, including business leaders, IT staff, and external vendors, to ensure that everyone is aligned and working towards the same goals. My ability to build relationships and foster teamwork is critical to the success of many of the projects I work on.

Overall, my experience as Senior Solution Architect for Global Business Applications at Kendrion NV is characterized by a deep commitment to delivering high-quality solutions that meet the needs of the business. My technical expertise, leadership skills, and collaborative approach make me a valuable asset to the company.
profile_positions.title: Senior Solution Architect - Global Business Applications

profile_positions.description:
As an ERP Solution Architect at Kendrion N.V., I was responsible for managing the company's existing ERP solution and providing solutions to business requirements that aligned with Kendrion's strategy towards standardization. I collaborated closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their business needs and requirements and developed solutions that met those needs while also aligning with Kendrion's overall strategic objectives.
One of my key accomplishments at Kendrion N.V. was improving the existing ERP solution's performance and functionality, resulting in increased operational efficiency and streamlined business processes. I worked closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that the system integrated seamlessly with existing systems and platforms, and that it was scalable, flexible, and secure.
Throughout my time at Kendrion N.V., I  was involved in training and support to end-users and other stakeholders, and maintained technical documentation and user manuals for ERP solutions. I collaborated closely with development teams to ensure that ERP solutions were integrated into existing systems and platforms, and I ensured that any modifications were aligned with Kendrion's standardization strategy.
I was also instrumental in managing the Changes to the ERP solution in line with Financial and Quality standards adhered by Kendrion.
profile_positions.title: ERP Solution Architect

profile_positions.description: As the Senior IT Business Partner Manufacturing at Kendrion, I am responsible for consulting and supporting the IFS ERP Applications landscape in the aspects of manufacturing, supply chain, sales, quality management and R&D.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior IFS Consultant at AUMA, I was responsible for the following, in relation to the IFS Applications ver. 10 implementation:
• Providing expertise on all the functional areas related to the implementation.
• Coordinating with the different stakeholders of the project including business process owners, the master users, management and IFS consultants, managing the expectation of all the stakeholders while adhering to the project timelines.
• Requirement gathering, preparing specifications, solution design, development and testing the solutions for identified gaps between the business processes and IFS Applications.
• Acting as the main point of contact for all IFS Functionality related issues and queries within AUMA.
• Assisting the solution management team to optimize the ERP blueprint by improving the quality while minimizing the costs.
profile_positions.title: Senior ERP Consultant (IFS)

profile_positions.description:
Senior IFS Consultant with 10+ years experience in:
o	IFS Complex MRO and VIM
o	IFS Manufacturing
o	IFS Supply Chain Management
o	IFS Maintenance
o	IFS Component MRO
o	IFS Quality Management
o	IFS Document Management

As the Manager – Business Consultancy Services (IFS) at WebQuarters, I am responsible for support and consultancy services delivery to all the IFS clients of WebQuarters in functional aspects.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Business Consultancy Services (IFS)

profile_positions.description:
As the Manager – Functional Support at Totalamber, I am responsible for support delivery to all the IFS clients of Totalamber in functional aspects. My team consists of highly experienced consultants in different functional areas of IFS and my responsibilities include:
•	Building and maintaining the team by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training team members while developing personal growth opportunities.
•	Accomplishing individual results by communicating job expectations, planning, monitoring, and appraising job results.
•	Coaching, counseling, and disciplining team members so that a healthy working environment is preserved where each personnel contributes in maintaining a positive organizational culture. 
•	Developing, coordinating and enforcing systems, policies, procedures, and productivity standards so that the support services are delivered within the Service Level Agreements and as per the ITIL guidelines.
•	Establishing strategic goals with respect to Financial, Business Growth, Client Delivery and Personal Development; identifying and evaluating trends and options; choosing a course of action; defining objectives; monitoring progress and evaluating outcomes.
•	Maintaining high quality service delivery by enforcing ITIL standards.
•	Contributing to team effort by accomplishing associated results as required.

Furthermore I continue to serve Totalamber as a Senior Functional Consultant in IFS ERP systems in addition to the aforementioned duties.
profile_positions.title: Functional Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Business Analyst at Totalamber Sri Lanka, I am responsible for providing onsite and remote assistance in reviewing, improving and supporting the following functional aspects of the clients with respect to the IFS applications:
•	Maintenance
•	Vehicle Information Management (VIM)/ Maintenance Repair and Overhaul (MRO)
•	Distribution
•	Manufacturing
•	Document Management
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
As the Cell Manager of the Strain Gauge Force Transducer Cell at Aero Sense (Pvt) Ltd, I managed the production of seven sensors which are exported to four leading aircraft manufacturers. A team leader, 22 skilled operators and 3 trainee operators directly reported to me. Furthermore I lead the production transfer of a product of the leading European Aircraft manufacturer, Airbus, from the UK facility of our company to the Sri Lankan facility fulfilling the requirements of AIRBUS GRESS (General Requirements for Equipment Systems Suppliers). 
The major responsibilities of my position included:
•	Implementing and maintaining the functionalities of the IFS Enterprise Resource Planning system with respect to manufacturing, distribution, maintenance and production scheduling 
•	Production planning based on the customer demand
•	Capacity planning and resource mitigation planning based on the forecasted sales
•	Allocating labour and resources to ensure that the production outputs meet the requirements of the production plan
•	Planning and allocating the resources for design and development activities
•	Maintaining the production and testing processes as per the requirements stated in ISO/AS9100 Rev. C
•	Effectively using LEAN Manufacturing techniques including Kaizen, Gemba, 5S, Kanban, PDCA, Poka-Yoke, Root Cause Analysis, Value Stream Mapping and Overall Equipment Effectiveness etc. for improving the Quality, Cost and Delivery
•	Planning and carrying out cross training of operators on different aspects of production process for ensuring a multi-skilled work force
•	Carrying out evaluations and appraisals for the subordinates 
•	Establishing and maintaining Key Performance Indicators with respect to Production
•	Responsible for developing the team spirit, maintaining discipline and ensuring that all work cell members comply with work instructions and regulations
profile_positions.title: Cell Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Planning, Implementation and maintenance of IFS Enterprise Resource Planning system maintaining the complete traceability as specified in ISO9001:AS9100 Rev.C standards with respect to production, maintenance, materials, procurement and quality.
•	Providing technical expertise and assistance for production to ensure proper performance of electrical and electronic production and testing activities 
•	Planning, developing, implementing and training the electrical and electronic aspects of new or changed products 
•	Developing automated test environments for new and on-going projects as continuous improvements on the manufacturing process
•	Ensuring that all electrical and electronic production and test equipments is functioning properly
•	Ensuring that detailed records of all electronic equipment used in production are kept and meet the requirements specified in AS9100 Rev.C
•	Responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the ESD protection system
•	Responsible for administrating the company Issue Tracking system – Roundup Issue Tracker
profile_positions.title: Electronic Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Involvement in the quality assurance aspects of the main software product of Millennium IT – Millennium Exchange.
•	Generating test scenarios, test cases and automating the test cases with respect to the relevant product.
•	Playing a pivotal role in the software quality assurance for the FAST and the FIX gateways of the Millennium Exchange product and its customized edition for the London Stock Exchange.
profile_positions.title: Quality Assurance Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Undertaking an internship in the Network Division of the worldwide telecommunications service provider HUTCH, as a part of the academic curriculum during the undergraduate period.
•	Gaining hands on training on all the aspects of Cellular Communication including network planning, microwave transmission, signalling and switching with respect to the GSM and 3G technologies.
•	Obtaining basic knowledge and training on GPRS and 3.5G wireless data communication technologies.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Telecommunications Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
I volunteered as a lecturer for Electronics and Electromagnetics at Flinth Training Institute, affiliated to Flinth Industrial Park. Flinth Training Institute has been established as a community service for providing technical and vocational education for the school leavers of the neighborhood as per the vision of Rune Flinth, the founder of The Flinth Industrial Park. It also aims at developing technical skills required for the sister companies of the Flinth Industrial Park and provide employment opportunities to the students in them.
I further took part in its activities as a music and dancing instructor supporting its attempt to provide a holistic learning experience at Flinth Training Institute.
